alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Clarion (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:20AM EST until February 19 at 7:45AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Allegheny River At Parker affecting Clarion and Armstrong Counties. Allegheny River At Rimer affecting Clarion and Armstrong Counties. Clarion River At Cooksburg affecting Jefferson PA, Clarion and Forest Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC005-031-190330- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0005.000000T0000Z-220219T1245Z/ /PARP1.1.ER.220219T0454Z.220219T0600Z.220219T0645Z.NO/ 1020 AM EST Fri Feb 18 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River at Parker. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Several homes on Route 268 flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 20.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 03/15/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
